main.name: Ahmad
main.bio: I am currently an undergraduate at Duke University studying Computer Science. I am fascinated by all kinds of technology, especially in the automotive industry. Currently I am working to launch a food point donation application to tackle student food insecurity at Duke; I am also the president of GTHC, working alongside Duke Men's Basketball to develop a shift-scheduling application for students partaking in the annual tenting tradition. You can check these projects out and many more below!
main.contactmessage: Get in touch with me using the form below:

education.description: President of Game Tenting Help Center, Member of Duke Applied Machine Learning, Muslim Student Association, Alpha Phi Omega, Questbridge Scholar

work.title: Software Engineer
work.description: Developed web application using Ruby on Rails, jQuery, and Transact API to allow students to donate food points to those in need. Authored onboarding documenation for future developers, held daily standups to delegate programming tasks to team members

work.title: IT Technician
work.description: Responsible for troubleshooting Windows and Apple products for Duke Medical students, as well as overseeing Duke Medical students' devices using Jamf and Airwatch to ensure security compliance

work.title: President
work.description: Responsible for developer recruiting/onboarding, application deployment, application design, task delegation among SW teams and assisting members with programming difficulties as needed

testimonials.text: Here you should write some nice things that someone has said about you. No lies though, employers can tell when you are lying.

That Tim Baker must be one of the most brilliant developers I've ever met! It is amazing that nobody has hired him yet. Hey you, you should hire this guy, he may be fresh out of University and have zero on the job experience but I am confident that he will be one of your best developers in no time!
